Melody

Typography

Home Getting Started Typography Layouts
Headings Quotes Lists

This is version 2 of Melody, which is currently under active development. As such, both this site and certain features of the framework may be broken.

If you do find issues, please raise a Github issue.

At the heart of all good CSS is structured typography. Melody includes the following elements, styled and ready to go.

Where possible, they follow the HTML output by Markdown parsers.

Headings

Heading 1

Heading 1 Alternate

HTML
<h1>Heading 1</h1>
<h1 class="alt">Heading 1</h1>

Heading 2

Heading 2 Alternate

HTML
<h2>Heading 2</h2>
<h2 class="alt">Heading 2</h2>

Heading 3

Heading 3 Alternate

HTML
<h3>Heading 3</h3>
<h3 class="alt">Heading 3</h3>

Heading 4

Heading 4 Alternate

HTML
<h4>Heading 4</h4>
<h4 class="alt">Heading 4</h4>
Heading 5
Heading 5 Alternate
HTML
<h5>Heading 5</h5>
<h5 class="alt">Heading 5</h5>
Heading 6
Heading 6 Alternate
HTML
<h6>Heading 6</h6>
<h6 class="alt">Heading 6</h6>

Quotes

Basic Blockquote

Sucking at something is the first step to becoming sorta good at something. Jake the Dog, Adventure Time

HTML
<blockquote>
  <p>
    Sucking at something is the first step to becoming sorta good at something.
    <cite>Jake the Dog, Adventure Time</cite>
  </p>
</blockquote>

Pull Quote

Sucking at something is the first step to becoming sorta good at something. Jake the Dog, Adventure Time

HTML
<blockquote class="pull">
  <p>
    Sucking at something is the first step to becoming sorta good at something.
    <cite>Jake the Dog, Adventure Time</cite>
  </p>
</blockquote>

Lists

Bullets

  • Item One
  • Item Two
  • Item Three
    • Nested Item One
    • Nested Item Two
  • Item Four
HTML
<ul>
  <li>Item One</li>
  <li>Item Two</li>
  <li>
    Item Three
    <ul>
      <li>Nested Item One</li>
      <li>Nested Item Two</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
  <li>Item Four</li>
</ul>

Numbered

  1. Item One
  2. Item Two
  3. Item Three
    1. Nested Item One
    2. Nested Item Two
  4. Item Four
HTML
<ol>
  <li>Item One</li>
  <li>Item Two</li>
  <li>
    Item Three
    <ol>
      <li>Nested Item One</li>
      <li>Nested Item Two</li>
    </ol>
  </li>
  <li>Item Four</li>
</ol>

Figures

Basic

HTML
<figure>
  <img src="http://www.placecage.com/300/200" alt="Nicholas Cage">
  <figcaption>
    <p>
      Check out that tash yo!
      <cite><a href="http://placecage.com">placecage.com</a></cite>
    </p>
  </figcaption>
</figure>

Full Width

HTML
<figure class="full-width">
  <img src="http://www.placecage.com/300/200" alt="Nicholas Cage">
  <figcaption>
    <p>
      Check out that tash yo!
      <cite><a href="http://placecage.com">placecage.com</a></cite>
    </p>
  </figcaption>
</figure>
